resources.string: WAEC PAST QUESTION APP
Title

In each of the following sentences, there is one underlined word and one gap. From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence. \n\n\t 1. The handsome profit from her fish business made Mrs. Uba stop complaining about her husband\'s ............ salary
\t 2. Chief Osa prefers fame in the village to ....... in the city.
\t 3. The media houses should employ both the novice and the ....... journalists.
\t 4. While the registrar considers the matter insignificant,his deputy sees it as ..........
\t 5. It pays to be firm rather than....... in a case like this.
\t 6. Usually, Joseph is articulate in his speech, but today, he sounds.........
\t 7. The man\'s first wife is loyal while the second is .........
\t 8. Rather than convict him, the impartial judge ......... him.
\t 9. Instead of reconciling her parents, Roxannce worked hard at .......them.
\t 10. We thought that Uncle Sam\'s health hadimproved but it had rather .........
SECTION 2: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best complete each of the following sentences.\n\n\t 11. One very important aspect of human relationship is .....trust.
\t 12. The two tasks were performed ......... and we were able to finish early.
\t 13. The committee is charged with finding a ...... solution to the crisis.
\t 14. We are worried by the ....... that exists between the two factions of the party.
\t 15. Our teacher was not speaking ....... when he said that the bursar was under a cloud.
\t 16. The signature on the document lacked ......., so it was rejected.
\t 17. everyone could tell that Binta ws happy from the ...... on her face.
\t 18. His last novel was ....... by his visits to the prisons.
\t 19. As a result of the power cut, production at the power factory came to a .........,
\t 20. Several ...... were passed at the meeting.

\t 22. My book has become dog-eared through use.
\t 23. Musa does not believe that there is poverty in Africa; he is a dyed-in-the-wool capitalist. This means that Musa is:
\t 24. Whenever my cousin comes to realise that I am telling the truth, she will eat the humble pie. This means that my cousin will .....
\t 25. I had dinner with Tony and Nick and they talked shop the whole time. This means that they talked .....
\t 26. His decision to reconcile with his former agent paid off. This means that the reconciliation
\t 27. The beauty of Bimpe\'s garden shows that she has green fingers. This means that Bimpe
\t 28. I would have visited you but for my father\'s ill health. This means that my
\t 29. Her husband\'s death has forced her to tighten her belt. This means that she has
\t 30. Some candidates take examinations in their stride. This means that they:

SECTION 4: From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the words or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it used in the sentence.\n\n\t 31. The provocation had an instantaneous effect on him.
\t 32. I woke up feeling rather queer.
\t 33. If he declines the offer, it will be better for him:
\t 34. Our club encourages benevolence.
\t 35. Such utterance areinimical to the peaceful co-existence of the two communities
\t 36. The chairman observed that Andrew was the most qualified candidate for the job.
\t 37. What do you intend to do with theseinanimate objects?
\t 38. Everybody noticed that the chairman\'s excuse was lame.
\t 39. The president appointed staunch supporters of his policies as advisers.
\t 40. the little boy gave his candid opinion of the incident.

SECTION 5: From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.\n\n\t 41. Why are you always jealous ..... other people
\t 42. It is sad that the rich .... pity the poor.
\t 43. The motorcycle nearly hit Jane and.........
\t 44. I found my friends sitting ........the beach.
\t 45. It is about time you ....... to bed.
\t 46. We shall not ......... WASSCE next May.
\t 47. One of his close friends ...... a soldier.
\t 48. Does OMar ........ in the city?
\t 49. The meeting of the ......... will come later today
\t 50. His father has a ........
\t 51. The teachers don\'t teach us,........
\t 52. we are no ....... friends
\t 53. Can you tell us how the accident came .......?
\t 54. She wondered if the water was not ....... hot for drinking.
\t 55. The robbers were subjected ....... a thorough beating by the irate mob.
\t 56. The cook should have ..... the pepper and tomatoes together
\t 57. My friend would not believe me if I ....... them this story.
\t 58. Even before his burial, Okoye\'s family members were already planning how to share his wealth .... themselves.
\t 59. The principal advised all the students to be of help to .......
\t 60. Mr. Ackon needed ....... help to succeed in the business.
\t 61. Susan has been urging me to join the ........
\t 62. Three kilometers ....... quite a long distance
\t 63. If they had known us, they ......
\t 64. The teacher made us ........ five poems each.
\t 65. Each one of the ten chosen contestants ...... lunch with the patron.
\t 66. The teacher needs ........ to write the note on the chalkboard.
\t 67. Madam Abike turned.......13 bags of maize at the first harvest.
\t 68. The teacher, as well as his students ........ working very hard.
\t 69. My mother remarked that it was high time we ....... preparing the supper.
\t 70. All we need ....... dedicated teachers.
